intro: Micromeles guanii, commonly known as the Guaní tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The tree produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
